strategy: Replace the gradient boosting model with a neural network (e.g., a shallow multi-layer perceptron) using a fully connected architecture. Instead of engineered features like 'FamilySize' or 'IsAlone', apply a deep feature transformation pipeline: use polynomial features up to degree 2 on 'Pclass', 'Age', and 'Fare' to capture nonlinear interactions, and normalize all inputs using z-score normalization. Apply dropout layers (10% dropout) to reduce overfitting and use cross-validation with stratified folds. Train on a time-series split (simulated as chronological order) to reflect the data collection order, which may improve generalization.
